oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tuber Development Rates of six Potato Varieties in Organic Farming in Osnabr端ck, Germany
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schliephake, Ulrike
Trautz, Dieter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: "Organics" in general
Root crops
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The yield formation of the used varieties (Annabelle, Anuschka, Belana, Princess, Ditta, Allians) are closely related to their maturity groups. Some variety differences within the maturity groups do exist. Is the development of yield satisfying after a terminated harvest (a date between the 75. and 80. days after planting is suggested) and no more yield formation is expected then it is not necessary to spray some supplements against Late Blight. In case of an expected yield development the medium early varieties like Ditta or Allians are showing, it might be necessary to keep these plants healthy and decide to spray permitted supplements because their tuber bulking is later then the other chosen varieties.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schliephake, Ulrike and Trautz, Dieter (2014) Tuber Development Rates of six Potato Varieties in Organic Farming in Osnabr端ck, Germany. In: Rahmann, G. and Aksoy, U. (Eds.) Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Th端nen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 2, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 383-386.
